item.title: Bankers in the APAC region predict a decrease in M&A activity under President Trump's administration
item.description: A recent survey of 300 Asia Pacific mergers and acquisitions (M&A) professionals conducted by Intralinks, a secure platform used by dealmakers for content sharing, found that 75% of respondents believe a potential presidency under Donald Trump would negatively impact M&A activity in the region. This mirrors the global sentiment revealed by Intralinks’ survey of 1,500 M&A professionals worldwide. Intralinks’ Global M&A Sentiment Survey shows 75% of Asian dealmakers consider Trump the most detrimental presidential candidate for M&A activity.
